title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
• 1 point is earned for the correct cell potential.

    Ecell = 0.34 V − (−1.31 V) = 1.65 V

  • 1 point is earned for indicating hte movement of OH- ions from right to left in the cell.

    (The arrow should point to the left.)
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

  • 1 point is earned for the correct cell potential.

    Ecell = 0.34 V − (−1.31 V) = 1.65 V

  • 1 point is earned for indicating hte movement of OH- ions from right to left in the cell.

    (The arrow should point to the left.)

    Ecell = 0.34 V − (−1.31 V) = 1.65 V

  • 1 point is earned for indicating hte movement of OH- ions from right to left in the cell.

    (The arrow should point to the left.)

The student response earns two of the following points:

  • 1 point is earned for the correct cell potential.

    Ecell = 0.34 V − (−1.31 V) = 1.65 V

  • 1 point is earned for indicating hte movement of OH- ions from right to left in the cell.

    (The arrow should point to the left.)

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
• 1 point is earned for indicating an increase in cell mass.

    The mass increases.

  • 1 point is earned for the justification.

    Oxygen gas from the air reacts with Zn(s) in the cell, producing ZnO(s), which has more mass than the original Zn(s).
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

  • 1 point is earned for indicating an increase in cell mass.

    The mass increases.

  • 1 point is earned for the justification.

    Oxygen gas from the air reacts with Zn(s) in the cell, producing ZnO(s), which has more mass than the original Zn(s).

The student response earns one of the following points:

  • 1 point is earned for indicating an increase in cell mass.

    The mass increases.

  • 1 point is earned for the justification.

    Oxygen gas from the air reacts with Zn(s) in the cell, producing ZnO(s), which has more mass than the original Zn(s).

The student response earns two of the following points:

  • 1 point is earned for indicating an increase in cell mass.

    The mass increases.

  • 1 point is earned for the justification.

    Oxygen gas from the air reacts with Zn(s) in the cell, producing ZnO(s), which has more mass than the original Zn(s).

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
• 1 point is earned for indicating a lower cell potential.

    The cell potential will be lower.

  • 1 point is earned for a justification that relates a lower pressure (or concentration) of O2(g) to Q, or a qualitative approach using the Nernst equation.

    O2(g), a reactant in the cell reaction, will be at a lower partial pressure at the higher elevation; thus the reaction has a greater value of Q (closer to K). Deviations in partial pressure that take the cell closer to equilibrium will decrease the magnitude of the cell potential.

title: Part E

    1s2 2s22p6 3s23p6 4s23d10 or [Ar]4s2 3d10
